benchmark_details.name: EMMOE (Embodied Mobile Manipulation in Open Environments)
benchmark_details.overview: EMMOE is a benchmark aimed at evaluating autonomous home robots' capabilities to interpret user instructions and execute long-horizon everyday tasks in continuous space. It integrates high-level and low-level embodied tasks into a unified framework, featuring new evaluation metrics and the EMMOE-100 dataset with various task attributes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and advance the development of intelligent autonomous robots through the execution of language-based tasks.

data.source: EMMOE-100 dataset collected using the Fetch robot in Habitat-Lab 2.0.
data.annotation: Manually annotated with task attributes, execution success status, and feedback mechanisms after failures.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on task execution success, keypath sequences for TP, and counting re-plans for SRR.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in TP, SR, SER, and SRR indicate better performance and reliability of the robotic agent.
methodology.baseline_results: HOMIE BOT-7B with SFT+DPO achieved high success rates across various metrics.
methodology.validation: Benchmark validated through systematic comparison of performance across multiple robotic models and tasks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data is derived from legally compliant sources and attributed to original creators.
